DataElement.preferredName: Vitamin B6 Laboratory Test Result Picogram Per Milliliter Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Vitamin B6 test result value in pg/ml

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the result of the medical procedure that involves testing a sample for Vitamin B6._A group of water-soluble vitamins essential for metabolism and normal physiological functions. B6 vitamins, including pyridoxine, pyridoxal, and pyridoxamine, are converted in vivo to pyridoxal phosphate, a cofactor necessary for the synthesis of amino acids, neurotransmitters, and sphingolipids.  More than 100 enzymes involved in protein metabolism require vitamin B6 as a cofactor. Vitamin B6 is essential to red blood cell, nervous system, and immune systems functions and helps maintain normal blood glucose levels. Vitamin B6 is found in a wide variety of foods including cereals, beans, meat, poultry, fish, and some fruits and vegetables. (NCI04)

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

More than 100 enzymes involved in protein metabolism require vitamin B6 as a cofactor. ValueDomain.preferredName: Laboratory Test Result Picogram Per Milliliter Value
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The outcome of a laboratory test in a Picogram Per Milliliter Value

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Laboratory Test Result Picogram Per Milliliter Value
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The outcome of a laboratory test.:The metric unit of mass equal to one trillionth of a gram (10E-12 gram).:For each, generally denoting a ratio.:A measure of volume for a liquid.  A milliliter is approximately 950 times smaller than a quart and 30 times smaller than a fluid ounce.  A milliliter of liquid and a cubic centimeter (cc) of liquid are the same.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: The outcome of a laboratory test.
The metric unit of mass equal to one trillionth of a gram (10E-12 gram).
For each, generally denoting a ratio.
A unit of volume equal to one millionth (10E-6) of a cubic meter, one thousandth of a liter, one cubic centimeter, or 0.061023 7 cubic inch. A cubic centimeter is the CGS unit of volume.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
